page.title: 02Ballingry: Transport
page.content:
The main bus route from Ballingry travels south through{Lochgelly,} south-west through{Cowdenbeath}and on to{Dunfermline.}To get to{Kirkcaldy} you have to change buses at Lochgelly and head south-east through{Cardenden. It is virtually impossible to travel by bus to{Glenrothes}which is Fife's new town and north-west of Ballingry. You can go by bus to{Edinburgh}via Dunfermline and the Forth Road Bridge. The nearest railway station is at Lochgelly. From there you can travel by train to Edinburgh,the Scottish borders and England.In the other direction the train only goes as far as Cardenden. { Edinburgh airport}is the nearest airport for travellers going abroad.
Lee Richardson (12)
